article_text: Even as many beneficiaries acknowledge that they might not have insurance today without the law, there remains a strong undercurrent of discontent. Though their insurance cards look the same as everyone else’s — with names like Liberty and Freedom from insurers like Anthem or United Health — the plans are often very different from those provided to most Americans by their employers. Many say they feel as if they have become second-class patients.

article_metadata.description: Even as many beneficiaries acknowledge that they might not have insurance today without the law, there remains a strong undercurrent of discontent.

article_summary:
Even as many beneficiaries acknowledge that they might not have insurance today without the law, there remains a strong undercurrent of discontent.
Many say they feel as if they have become second-class patients.
Though their insurance cards look the same as everyone else’s — with names like Liberty and Freedom from insurers like Anthem or United Health — the plans are often very different from those provided to most Americans by their employers.
